required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Access of Daratumumab Combined With VRD in the Treatment of Patients With Standard-risk Newly Diagnosed MM
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Daratumumab Combined With VRD in the Treatment of Patients With Newly Diagnosed Standard-risk Multiple Myeloma : a Single-center, Single-arm Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single arm study to access the effect of treatment with D-VRD in patients with newly diagnosed standard risk multiple myeloma.

detailed_description.textblock: Research object:Newly diagnosed standard-risk multiple myeloma (NDMM) diagnosed according to the International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) standards and who have been assessed to receive Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation (ASCT) but actively refused.Objective: To explore the therapeutic options of daratumamab (D) combined with bortezomib (V), lenalidomide (R) and dexamethasone ( d) for objective assessment of patients who can receive ASCT but not to receive transplantation.Main indicators:negative rate of minimal residual disease (MRD) upon completion of cycle 8 (24 weeks).

primary_outcome.measure: rate of minimal residual disease negativity
primary_outcome.description: rate of minimal residual disease negativity

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
